meanings.definition: Of or relating to an imaginary or spiritual world beyond the physical world.
meanings.sent1: The movie had an otherworldly feel, transporting viewers to a magical realm.
meanings.sent2: The painting depicted an otherworldly landscape with mystical creatures.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fascination with the vacuum cleaner was almost otherworldly.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was so enchanting, it seemed to possess an otherworldly quality.
meanings.sent5: The aurora borealis painted an otherworldly sky with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a world beyond the physical world.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins had an otherworldly appearance, as if from a distant time.
meanings.sent2: The eerie mist gave the forest an otherworldly aura.
meanings.sent3: The old bookshop had an otherworldly charm that drew in curious visitors.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned mansion stood silent and otherworldly in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious artifact emitted an otherworldly glow in the darkness.

meanings.sent1: The ghostly figure had an otherworldly presence, sending shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent2: The strange sounds coming from the attic had an otherworldly origin.
meanings.sent3: The sudden appearance of a rainbow during the storm felt otherworldly.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious fog enveloped the town in an otherworldly haze.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned church felt truly otherworldly.
